meanings.sent1: I will preprogram the robot to move forward.
meanings.sent2: She always preprograms her coffee maker the night before.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to preprogram the oven to start baking while he was out.
meanings.sent4: The student preprogrammed his alarm clock to wake him up early for the exam.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preprogram your phone with important reminders for tomorrow.

meanings.definition: The act of programming in advance.
meanings.sent1: Preprogramming is essential for efficient automation.
meanings.sent2: The preprogramming of the system saved a lot of time.
meanings.sent3: The preprogramming of the lights made the house look magical.
meanings.sent4: Her preprogramming skills impressed the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project was due to careful preprogramming.
